abstract: Consumer Reports said “bug-ridden redesigns” were behind the automaker’s fall from first to third place in the magazine’s annual “Best & Worst New Cars” survey.
snippet: Consumer Reports said “bug-ridden redesigns” were behind the automaker’s fall from first to third place in the magazine’s annual “Best & Worst New Cars” survey.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Oct. 16 The magazine Consumer Reports says that “bug-ridden redesigns” caused Toyota Motor of Japan to drop unexpectedly to third, from first, in its annual vehicle reliability rankings released on Tuesday.

headline.main: Toyota Loses Top Spot in Reliability Rankings
headline.print_headline: Toyota Falls to No. 3 in Reliability Rankings
